segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erika.
We're bringing you an advanced lesson today.
segments.cn: 今天我们带来一节高级课程。

segments.en: That's right.
An advanced lesson where we talk about investing in emerging markets.
segments.cn: 一节关于投资新兴市场的高级课程。

segments.en: Right.
So it's kind of a business topic.
segments.cn: 所以这算是一个商业话题。

segments.en: It's kind of a world topic as well.
Yes.
And it's pretty difficult.
Yeah, it is really hard.
Right.
So if you're listening and you don't understand everything, please don't get discouraged.
segments.cn: 所以如果你在听而且不理解所有内容，请不要气馁。

segments.en: Don't worry about it because we're here to learn.
segments.cn: 不用担心，因为我们在这里学习。

segments.en: Yes.
And we're here to help you.
Right.
So let's get started with this.
I'm really excited about this lesson.
Yeah.
Okay.
Well, Marco, maybe you can tell us a little bit.
segments.cn: 好吧，Marco，也许你可以告诉我们一点。

segments.en: What is an emerging market?
An emerging market is a market that is starting to develop.
segments.cn: 新兴市场是一个开始发展的市场。

segments.en: Okay.
And it's growing rapidly.
So you can maybe give some examples of emerging market.
segments.cn: 所以你可以给一些新兴市场的例子。

segments.en: Well, for example, China is an emerging market.
segments.cn: 嗯，例如，中国就是一个新兴市场。

segments.en: In the last years, it's been growing rapidly.
segments.cn: 在过去几年中，它增长迅速。

segments.en: More and more people are moving to the middle class and have money to spend.
segments.cn: 越来越多的人进入中产阶级，有钱可花。

segments.en: Right.
Exactly.
So China is like a really great example of an emerging market.
segments.cn: 所以中国是一个非常好的新兴市场例子。

segments.en: All right.
Well, with that, let's listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 那么，接下来我们第一次听对话。

segments.en: Dad, I'd like to borrow some money.
Sure, Johnny.
How much do you need?
Five bucks?
Come on, Dad.
I need 30,000.
I want to get into the market.
You know, I'm tired of hearing all this news about the economic downturn, the inevitable recession, people stuffing their money in their mattresses.
segments.cn: 你知道，我厌倦了听到经济衰退、不可避免的衰退、以及人们把钱塞进床垫的新闻。

segments.en: I look at this as an opportunity.
This is a chance for me to get a jumpstart on building my nest egg.
segments.cn: 这是我建立我的养老金的一个良机。

segments.en: I don't know about that.
With all the uncertainty in the markets right now, it'll be a very unwise decision to invest.
segments.cn: 在目前市场的不确定性下，投资将是一个非常不明智的决定。

segments.en: I don't know if you're aware, son, but there has been a lot of turmoil in the markets recently.
segments.cn: 我不知道你是否意识到，儿子，但最近市场上发生了很多动荡。

segments.en: There have already been half a million layoffs in the last few months, and we have no idea how the proposed stimulus package will impact upon the economy.
segments.cn: 在过去几个月中，已经有五十万的裁员，我们不知道提议的刺激计划将如何影响经济。

segments.en: There's just too much instability.
I just wouldn't feel comfortable investing in this climate.
segments.cn: 我在这种气候下投资会感到不安。

segments.en: But look at it this way.
Every challenge is an opportunity.
segments.cn: 每个挑战都是一个机会。

segments.en: And anyway, I'm not talking about investing in the domestic market.
segments.cn: 而且，我并不是在谈论投资国内市场。

segments.en: There are emerging markets that promise great returns.
segments.cn: 还有一些新兴市场承诺有很好的回报。

segments.en: Look at China, for example.
They have 1.4 billion people, half a billion of whom have recently entered the middle class.
segments.cn: 他们有14亿人，其中有5亿人最近进入了中产阶级。

segments.en: Here alone, the aggregate demand for consumer goods represents an amazing wealth-generating opportunity.
segments.cn: 仅在这里，消费品的总需求代表了一个惊人的财富创造机会。

segments.en: Come on, son.
You're looking at this too naively.
The Chinese market has exhibited a great deal of instability, and their currency has been devalued by almost a whole percentage point.
segments.cn: 中国市场表现出很大的不稳定性，他们的货币贬值了近一个百分点。

segments.en: Fine then.
If that's the way you feel, so be it.
segments.cn: 如果你这样觉得，那就这样吧。

segments.en: But you're losing out on a great opportunity here.
segments.cn: 但你在这里错过了一个很好的机会。

segments.en: I'm gonna hit up mom for the cash.
Well, it sounds like the dad has missed out on a really big investment opportunity, hey?
segments.cn: 好吧，听起来爸爸错过了一个很大的投资机会，是吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and his son is pretty smart.
Pretty smart little boy.
Okay, so we have some great words that we want to look at here.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有一些很好的词想要看一下。

segments.en: Why don't we start with the first one?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不从第一个开始呢？

segments.en: Turmoil.
Turmoil.
Turmoil.
Turmoil.
So we have some great examples of how turmoil is used in different sentences, so let's listen.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一些很好的例子，展示了动荡在不同句子中的用法，让我们来听听。

segments.en: Example 1.
With a civil war, a famine, and inflation, the country has been in turmoil for ten years.
segments.cn: 在内战、饥荒和通货膨胀的影响下，这个国家已经动荡了十年。

segments.en: Example 2.
There's been a lot of turmoil in my life recently.
segments.cn: 最近我的生活中发生了很多动荡。

segments.en: I've moved to a new city, I've changed my job, I broke up with my girlfriend.
segments.cn: 我搬到了一个新城市，换了工作，和女朋友分手了。

segments.en: Example 3.
Example 4.
The devaluation of the dollar caused a great deal of turmoil in the markets.
segments.cn: 美元贬值导致市场出现了很大的动荡。

segments.en: So turmoil is a state of... Of uncertainty, of change, of difficult times.
segments.cn: 所以动荡是一种……不确定、变化、困难时期的状态。

segments.en: A little bit of chaos.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
So, for example, when there's a lot of turmoil in the market, that means stock prices are changing drastically from day to day.
segments.cn: 所以，例如，当市场上有很多动荡时，这意味着股票价格每天都在剧烈变化。

segments.en: Right, or the economy is in turmoil, there's a lot of problems going on.
segments.cn: 对，或者经济动荡，发生了很多问题。

segments.en: Yeah, uncertainty.
Uncertainty, okay.
Good word.
All right, and we also saw something really interesting in the dialogue about a proposed stimulus package.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在对话中还看到了一些关于提议的刺激计划的有趣内容。

segments.en: A proposed stimulus package.
So a proposed stimulus package is something that's going on now.
segments.cn: 所以提议的刺激计划是现在正在进行的事情。

segments.en: Yes, let's break this phrase down.
segments.cn: 是的，让我们分解一下这个短语。

segments.en: So we've got stimulus package.
A stimulus package, something to stimulate the economy, right?
segments.cn: 刺激计划，旨在刺激经济，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so money from the government to get the economy moving.
segments.cn: 对，所以是政府提供的钱来推动经济发展。

segments.en: To get it moving, stimulus package.
Proposed.
It means that it hasn't been approved yet.
segments.cn: 这意味着它还没有被批准。

segments.en: Right, it's suggested.
It's suggested, it's an idea.
So the proposed stimulus package for the U.S.
segments.cn: 所以美国的提议刺激计划，例如，是1500亿美元。

segments.en: economy, for example, is 150 billion dollars.
segments.cn: 对，这1500亿美元是美国纳税人的钱，政府想投入经济以保持其运转。

segments.en: Right, that's 150 billion dollars of American taxpayers money that the government wants to put into the economy to keep it moving.
So if it works or not, that's still a debate, but it's a proposed stimulus package.
segments.cn: 所以它是否有效，仍然是个争论，但这是一个提议的刺激计划。

segments.en: Let's move to our third phrase.
segments.cn: 让我们转到第三个短语。

segments.en: Aggregate demand.
Aggregate demand.
Aggregate demand.
Aggregate demand.
So demand is pretty clear, but this word aggregate, what's that about?
segments.cn: 所以需求是很明确的，但这个词总的，是什么意思？

segments.en: Aggregate is like a combined, added, right?
segments.cn: 总的就像是合并的、增加的，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah.
Aggregate demand.
For example, in a country like China, where cities like in Shanghai or cities like Beijing, where more and more people are accumulating wealth, the aggregate demand is increasing.
segments.cn: 例如，在像中国这样的国家，像上海或北京这样的城市，越来越多的人积累财富，总需求在增加。

segments.en: Right, right.
The combined demand for consumer goods is growing.
segments.cn: 消费品的综合需求在增长。

segments.en: Right.
More people have more money, so they're spending more.
segments.cn: 更多的人有更多的钱，所以他们花得更多。

segments.en: Yes.
Okay.
You know, Marco, there's a ton of excellent language in this dialogue, isn't there?
segments.cn: 你知道，马尔科，这段对话中有很多优秀的语言，不是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, a lot of good stuff here.
segments.cn: 是的，这里有很多好东西。

segments.en: Yeah, and we want to listen to the dialogue one more time, but before we do, we have three words for you that we want you to listen for.
segments.cn: 是的，我们想再听一遍对话，但在此之前，我们有三个词想让你注意。

segments.en: Yeah, pay attention to these words.
Nest egg.
Nest egg.
Inevitable.
Inevitable.
And hit up.
Hit up.
So from the context of the dialogue, try and see if you can figure out what they mean.
segments.cn: 所以从对话的上下文中，试着看看你能否弄清楚它们的意思。

segments.en: But after listening to it, we'll come back and explain it anyways.
segments.cn: 但听完后，我们会回来解释。

segments.en: Dad, I'd like to borrow some money.
Sure, Johnny, how much do you need?
segments.cn: 当然，约翰尼，你需要多少？

segments.en: Five bucks?
Come on, Dad, I need 30,000.
I want to get into the market.
You know, I'm tired of hearing all this news about the economic downturn, the inevitable recession, people stuffing their money in their mattresses.
segments.cn: 你知道，我厌倦了听到关于经济衰退、不可避免的衰退、以及人们把钱塞进床垫的新闻。

segments.en: I look at this as an opportunity.
This is a chance for me to get a jumpstart on building my nest egg.
segments.cn: 这是我建立存款的跳板。

segments.en: I don't know about that.
With all the uncertainty in the markets right now, it'd be a very unwise decision to invest.
segments.cn: 在目前市场的不确定性下，投资将是一个非常不明智的决定。

segments.en: I don't know if you're aware, son, but there has been a lot of turmoil in the markets recently.
segments.cn: 我不知道你是否知道，儿子，但最近市场上发生了很多动荡。

segments.en: There have already been half a million layoffs in the last few months, and we have no idea how the proposed stimulus package will impact upon the economy.
segments.cn: 在过去几个月里，已经有五十万的裁员，我们不知道提议的刺激计划将如何影响经济。

segments.en: There's just too much instability.
I just wouldn't feel comfortable investing in this climate.
segments.cn: 我在这种气候下不会感到舒适去投资。

segments.en: But look at it this way.
Every challenge is an opportunity.
segments.cn: 每个挑战都是一个机会。

segments.en: And anyway, I'm not talking about investing in the domestic market.
segments.cn: 而且，我并不是在谈论投资国内市场。

segments.en: There are emerging markets that promise great returns.
segments.cn: 有新兴市场承诺高回报。

segments.en: Look at China, for example.
They have 1.4 billion people, half a billion of whom have recently entered the middle class.
segments.cn: 他们有14亿人，其中5亿人最近进入了中产阶级。

segments.en: Here alone, the aggregate demand for consumer goods represents an amazing wealth-generating opportunity.
segments.cn: 仅在这里，消费品的总需求代表了一个惊人的财富创造机会。

segments.en: Oh, come on, son, you're looking at this too naively.
segments.cn: 哦，拜托，儿子，你看得太天真了。

segments.en: The Chinese market has exhibited a great deal of instability, and their currency has been devalued by almost a whole percentage point.
segments.cn: 中国市场表现出很大的不稳定性，他们的货币贬值了近一个百分点。

segments.en: Fine, then.
If that's the way you feel, so be it.
segments.cn: 如果你觉得是这样，那就这样吧。

segments.en: But you're losing out on a great opportunity here.
segments.cn: 但你在这里错过了一个很好的机会。

segments.en: I'm gonna hit up mom for the cash.
So the kid wants to invest because he wants to set up his nest egg.
segments.cn: 所以这个孩子想投资，因为他想建立他的存款。

segments.en: That's right.
So basically he wants to get a bunch of cash together so that he can buy a house or get married or whatever.
segments.cn: 所以基本上他想凑一笔钱，以便买房子或结婚或其他。

segments.en: It's that money you need to start your life, right?
segments.cn: 这是你开始生活所需的钱，对吧？

segments.en: To start your life, your nest egg.
segments.cn: 开始你的生活，你的存款。

segments.en: It's kind of a weird way of referring to this money, right?
segments.cn: 这是一种奇怪的方式来指代这笔钱，对吧？

segments.en: I guess it is kind of funny.
And also the little boy talked about an inevitable recession.
segments.cn: 而且小男孩还谈到了不可避免的衰退。

segments.en: Yes, inevitable.
Inevitable.
Inevitable basically means unavoidable.
segments.cn: 不可避免基本上意味着不可避免。

segments.en: Right.
So this guy thinks that the recession is unavoidable.
segments.cn: 所以这个家伙认为衰退是不可避免的。

segments.en: It's gonna happen.
Yes, inevitable.
You know, this word inevitable, if you apply the root words, you can get a noun, an adjective, or an adverb, right?
segments.cn: 你知道，这个词不可避免，如果你应用根词，你可以得到名词、形容词或副词，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
So we've got some examples where you can see this word.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一些例子可以看到这个词。

segments.en: In action.
Example one.
Jason knew he was going to get laid off, but he was trying to delay the inevitable.
segments.cn: 杰森知道他会被裁员，但他试图推迟不可避免的事情。

segments.en: Example two.
As a new manager, it's inevitable that you're going to make mistakes.
segments.cn: 作为一名新经理，你不可避免地会犯错误。

segments.en: Example three.
Inevitably, we all die at the end of our lives.
segments.cn: 不可避免地，我们都在生命的尽头死去。

segments.en: So as you can see, the noun and adjective form are the same.
segments.cn: 所以正如你所看到的，名词和形容词形式是相同的。

segments.en: Yes, inevitable.
Inevitable.
When we use it as an adverb, though, we add the ly to it.
segments.cn: 当我们用作副词时，我们加上ly。

segments.en: Inevitably.
Inevitably.
Yes.
So yeah, as you can see, we could use it in many different ways, depending on what we want to say.
segments.cn: 所以是的，你可以看到，我们可以用它以多种不同的方式，取决于我们想说什么。

segments.en: Right.
Well, inevitably, we have to move on to our third word.
segments.cn: 好吧，必然地，我们得继续我们的第三个词。

segments.en: Hit up.
Hit up.
So he says he's going to hit up mom for the cash.
segments.cn: 所以他说他要向妈妈要现金。

segments.en: Ask his mom.
Hit up.
Yeah, this is kind of a slangy term, isn't it?
segments.cn: 是的，这算是一种俚语，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, it's more informal, a lot more slangy.
segments.cn: 是的，更非正式，很多俚语。

segments.en: You wouldn't really use it with your boss, would you?
segments.cn: 你不会真的在老板面前用这个词，对吧？

segments.en: No, you're not going to go up to your boss and say, hey, I need to hit you up for some cash.
segments.cn: 不，你不会走到老板面前说，嘿，我需要向你请求一些现金。

segments.en: So Marco, I think this word is only applying to money, right?
segments.cn: 所以马尔科，我认为这个词只适用于钱，对吧？

segments.en: Well, you wouldn't go up to your boss and say, oh, I need to hit you up for some vacation time.
segments.cn: 嗯，你不会走到老板面前说，哦，我需要向你请求一些假期时间。

segments.en: No, it's typically used for money.
In this context.
Yeah.
Hit them up.
We've got some examples of the phrase hit up.
segments.cn: 我们有一些“向...请求”的例子。

segments.en: Let's listen.
Example one.
I'm going to hit up the boss for a raise.
segments.cn: 我打算向老板请求加薪。

segments.en: Example two.
Are you trying to hit me up for money?
segments.cn: 你是在试图向我请求钱吗？

segments.en: Example three.
I don't have any cash.
Have you tried hitting up Sophie?
She's rich.
OK, so this is our first advanced lesson.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们的第一节高级课程。

segments.en: I hope you enjoyed it.
It is a lot more challenging, I think.
Yes.
Especially because it's set in a business context.
segments.cn: 尤其是因为它设定在商业环境中。

segments.en: So we have a lot of specific words and a lot of technical vocabulary.
segments.cn: 所以我们有很多特定的词汇和很多专业术语。

segments.en: That's right.
Marco, you're exactly right.
segments.cn: 马尔科，你说得完全正确。

segments.en: And I think that our users are going to have a lot of questions about the language in this lesson.
segments.cn: 我认为我们的用户会对这节课的语言有很多问题。

segments.en: So I'd like to invite you guys to come onto our website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以我想邀请你们访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Exactly.
Where you can leave all your questions and comments and we'll be there to answer them.
segments.cn: 在那里你可以留下所有问题和评论，我们会在那里回答。

segments.en: But until then, it's goodbye.
